About Me...

My Life In Tech

Growing up, I was the eldest of my siblings and the go-to for all things tech. There was never a dull moment, from setting up wireless equipment to configuring home printer settings. I expanded upon this by enlisting as a 25U - Signal Support Systems Specialist. in the U.S. Army Reserve. While sharpening my basic computing skills, I gained experience establishing and maintaining communication networks for mission-critical operations.

As someone passionate about learning, I always seek the next challenge. I set my eyes on conquering my first industry certification, the CompTIA Security+ Certification, and graduated from Bottega University's Full Stack Development Program. Since 2020, I've used these newfound skills to build several web-based apps and provide endpoint security for organizations on the job.

I developed a holistic understanding of cybersecurity and software development concepts with these talents. I've helped implement company-owned device security and authored standard operating procedures for end-user troubleshooting. Seeing how far I've come from simple home networks to developing live full-stack web applications is impressive.

I look to continue maintaining communication networks, secure applications, and providing real-time solutions. I am developing software tools in my spare time and pursuing more industry certifications to aid organizations in solving complex problems.
